drugDrugInteractions.recommendation: Avoid sulfonamide antibiotics and sulfa-containing medications. Use alternative antibiotics.

aspirinAllergy.recommendation: Avoid aspirin and potentially other NSAIDs. Consider acetaminophen for pain relief.
aspirinAllergy.description: Concurrent use significantly increases the risk of major bleeding, especially gastrointestinal bleeding.

drugDrugInteractions.recommendation: Avoid combination if possible. If necessary, monitor INR closely and check for signs of bleeding. Consider PPI for GI protection.

drugAllergyInteractions.recommendation: Avoid codeine and related opioids. Consider alternative pain management strategies.

warfarinNsaid.description: NSAIDs can reduce renal blood flow and cause acute kidney injury in patients with pre-existing kidney disease.
warfarinNsaid.recommendation: Avoid NSAIDs. Consider alternative analgesics like acetaminophen.

drugDrugInteractions.description: Concurrent use significantly increases the risk of major bleeding, especially gastrointestinal bleeding.

aceInhibitorKidneyDisease.recommendation: Avoid combination if possible. If necessary, monitor INR closely and check for signs of bleeding. Consider PPI for GI protection.

warfarinAspirin.description: ACE inhibitors can affect kidney function. Use with caution in patients with renal impairment.
warfarinAspirin.recommendation: Start with a low dose and monitor serum creatinine and potassium levels regularly.

drugDrugInteractions.description: Combination dramatically increases bleeding risk, particularly intracranial and GI hemorrhage.

drugAllergyInteractions.recommendation: Avoid unless specifically indicated. If necessary, use lowest aspirin dose and monitor closely.

anticoagulantAntiplatelet.description: Dual anticoagulation increases bleeding risk significantly.
anticoagulantAntiplatelet.recommendation: Use only when benefits outweigh risks. Monitor for bleeding signs regularly.

ssriNsaid.description: SSRIs affect platelet function; combined with NSAIDs increases GI bleeding risk.
ssriNsaid.recommendation: Monitor for signs of bleeding. Consider PPI for gastroprotection.

doacAntiplatelet.description: Combined use increases bleeding risk substantially.
doacAntiplatelet.recommendation: Use only when clinically necessary. Monitor closely for bleeding.

aceInhibitorPotassiumSparing.description: Both classes can increase potassium levels, leading to hyperkalemia.
aceInhibitorPotassiumSparing.recommendation: Monitor serum potassium regularly. Adjust doses if levels elevate.

arbPotassiumSparing.description: Combined use significantly increases hyperkalemia risk.
arbPotassiumSparing.recommendation: Regular potassium monitoring essential. Consider alternative diuretics.

lithiumDiuretic.description: Diuretics reduce lithium clearance, increasing risk of lithium toxicity.
lithiumDiuretic.recommendation: Monitor lithium levels closely. May need dose reduction.

digoxinDiuretic.description: Diuretics can cause hypokalemia, increasing digoxin toxicity risk.
digoxinDiuretic.recommendation: Monitor potassium and digoxin levels. Supplement potassium if needed.

statinFibrate.description: Increased risk of myopathy and rhabdomyolysis.
statinFibrate.recommendation: Monitor for muscle pain, weakness. Check CPK if symptoms develop.

macroli deStatin.description: Macrolides inhibit statin metabolism, increasing myopathy risk.
macroli deStatin.recommendation: Consider temporarily holding statin during macrolide therapy.

benzodiazepineOpioid.description: Combined CNS depression significantly increases respiratory depression and overdose risk.
benzodiazepineOpioid.recommendation: Avoid combination. If unavoidable, use lowest effective doses and monitor closely.

ssriMaoi.description: Risk of serotonin syndrome with excessive serotonergic activity.
ssriMaoi.recommendation: Avoid combining multiple serotonergic agents. Monitor for serotonin syndrome symptoms.

tramadolSsri.description: Tramadol combined with SSRIs increases serotonin syndrome risk.
tramadolSsri.recommendation: Monitor for agitation, hyperthermia, hyperreflexia. Use alternative analgesics if possible.

antipsychoticQtProlonging.description: Both can prolong QT interval, increasing risk of torsades de pointes.
antipsychoticQtProlonging.recommendation: Monitor ECG. Avoid in patients with QT prolongation risk factors.

fluoroquinoloneNsaid.description: Increased risk of CNS stimulation and seizures.
fluoroquinoloneNsaid.recommendation: Monitor for seizures, especially in patients with seizure disorders.

methotrexateNsaid.description: NSAIDs may increase methotrexate toxicity by reducing renal clearance.
methotrexateNsaid.recommendation: Monitor methotrexate levels and CBC. Use with caution.

immunosuppressantLiveVaccine.description: Immunosuppression increases risk of infection from live vaccines.
immunosuppressantLiveVaccine.recommendation: Avoid live vaccines during immunosuppression. Use inactivated alternatives.

calciumChannelBlockerBetaBlocker.description: Combined negative chronotropic and inotropic effects can cause bradycardia and heart block.
calciumChannelBlockerBetaBlocker.recommendation: Monitor heart rate and blood pressure. Use with caution in elderly.

pde5InhibitorNitrate.description: Combination causes severe hypotension, potentially fatal.

insulinSulfonylurea.description: Both lower glucose; combined use increases hypoglycemia risk.
insulinSulfonylurea.recommendation: Monitor blood glucose closely. Adjust doses to prevent hypoglycemia.

corticosteroidNsaid.description: Significantly increased risk of GI ulceration and bleeding.
corticosteroidNsaid.recommendation: Avoid if possible. Consider PPI for gastroprotection if necessary.

azoleStatin.description: Azole antifungals inhibit statin metabolism, increasing myopathy risk.
azoleStatin.recommendation: Consider temporary statin discontinuation during azole therapy.

tcaMaoi.description: Risk of hypertensive crisis and serotonin syndrome.
tcaMaoi.recommendation: Allow 2-week washout period between switching classes.

theophyllineFluoroquinolone.recommendation: Monitor theophylline levels and adjust dose as needed.

anticonvulsantOralContraceptive.recommendation: Use additional contraceptive methods or higher-dose contraceptives.

nsaidKidneyDisease.description: NSAIDs can reduce renal blood flow and cause acute kidney injury in patients with pre-existing kidney disease.
nsaidKidneyDisease.recommendation: Avoid NSAIDs. Consider alternative analgesics like acetaminophen.

nsaidHeartFailure.description: NSAIDs cause sodium retention and can exacerbate heart failure.
nsaidHeartFailure.recommendation: Avoid NSAIDs. Use acetaminophen for pain relief.

aceInhibitorKidneyDisease.description: ACE inhibitors can affect kidney function, especially in severe renal impairment.
aceInhibitorKidneyDisease.recommendation: Start with low dose and monitor serum creatinine and potassium levels regularly.

betaBlockerAsthma.description: Beta-blockers can cause bronchospasm in patients with reactive airway disease.
betaBlockerAsthma.recommendation: Avoid non-selective beta-blockers. If essential, use cardioselective agents with caution.

benzodiazepineCopd.description: Benzodiazepines may cause respiratory depression in COPD patients.
benzodiazepineCopd.recommendation: Use with extreme caution. Consider alternative anxiolytics.

opioidSleepApnea.description: Opioids worsen respiratory depression in sleep apnea.
opioidSleepApnea.recommendation: Avoid if possible. If necessary, use lowest effective dose and monitor closely.

anticholinergicGlaucoma.recommendation: Avoid in narrow-angle glaucoma. Use with caution in open-angle glaucoma.

corticosteroidDiabetes.recommendation: Monitor glucose closely. May need adjustment of diabetes medications.

nsaidGastrointestinalDisease.description: NSAIDs increase risk of GI bleeding and ulceration.
nsaidGastrointestinalDisease.recommendation: Avoid NSAIDs. If essential, use with PPI protection.

antipsychoticDementia.description: Antipsychotics increase mortality risk in elderly patients with dementia.
antipsychoticDementia.recommendation: Use only when non-pharmacological measures fail. Use lowest effective dose.

lithiumKidneyDisease.description: Lithium is renally cleared; impaired function increases toxicity risk.
lithiumKidneyDisease.recommendation: Monitor lithium levels more frequently. May need significant dose reduction.

metforminKidneyDisease.description: Risk of lactic acidosis in renal impairment.
metforminKidneyDisease.recommendation: Contraindicated in severe renal impairment (GFR <30). Reduce dose in moderate impairment.

thiazolidinedioneHeartFailure.description: Thiazolidinediones cause fluid retention and worsen heart failure.
thiazolidinedioneHeartFailure.recommendation: Contraindicated in Class III-IV heart failure.

stimulantHypertension.description: Stimulants increase blood pressure and heart rate.
stimulantHypertension.recommendation: Monitor blood pressure regularly. Control hypertension before starting stimulants.

nsaidHypertension.description: NSAIDs can elevate blood pressure and reduce antihypertensive efficacy.
nsaidHypertension.recommendation: Monitor blood pressure. Use acetaminophen as alternative.

tricyclicCardiacDisease.description: Tricyclics can cause cardiac conduction abnormalities and arrhythmias.
tricyclicCardiacDisease.recommendation: Avoid in recent MI or heart block. Monitor ECG if use necessary.

fluoroquinoloneTendon.description: Increased risk of tendon rupture, especially in elderly and those on corticosteroids.
fluoroquinoloneTendon.recommendation: Avoid in patients with tendon disorders. Discontinue if tendon pain develops.

immunosuppressantInfection.description: Immunosuppression increases infection risk and severity.
immunosuppressantInfection.recommendation: Screen for latent infections before starting. Monitor closely for signs of infection.

potassiumSparingHyperkalemia.description: Can worsen hyperkalemia, leading to cardiac arrhythmias.
potassiumSparingHyperkalemia.recommendation: Monitor potassium levels closely. Avoid in severe hyperkalemia.

anticoagulantBleedingDisorder.description: Dramatically increases bleeding risk in patients with bleeding disorders.
anticoagulantBleedingDisorder.recommendation: Generally contraindicated. If essential, requires hematology consultation.
